title: Sri Lanka Finance Minister Rajapaksa leaves for India to sign $1 bn bailout package
snippet: Sri Lanka's Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa on Tuesday left for New Delhi to ink a fresh $1 billion bailout package with India, amid a crippling economic meltdown staring at the island nation. Rajapaksa left for India for a two-day official visit for crucial talks with the Indian Government for broader financial assistance to tide over Sri Lanka's economic crisis.

title: Sri Lanka angry crowd tries to storm president's office over economic woes
snippet: Frustration flared over runaway prices during financial crisis, with long queues outside petrol stations and rolling blackouts the norm.

title: Sri Lankan finance minister to visit India today
snippet: Amid the worsening economic situation in his country, Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa will begin his India visit on Tuesday, hoping to seal a USD 1 billion line of credit (LoC). title: Sri Lanka: What's Premadasa's option in the national crisis?
snippet: While the ruling powers of crisis-ridden Lanka are considering the IMF as a three letter word ending in F and dissenters view that it is the only way out of the national crisis, today's suffering people of this once proclaimed paradise island are exercising their only available option: coming on to the streets on their own and demonstrating against the rulers.

title: Sri Lanka shares fall for third straight session; mkt shrugs off decision for IMF help
snippet: Sri Lanka stock index dropped for a third straight session on Tuesday (14) to a near one-week low as economic uncertainties after the currency depreciation weighed on the sentiment, brokers said. Investors shrugged off a government decision that the cabinet had given approval for the Finance Minister to seek International Monetary Fund assistance to address the current economic crisis.

title: Sri Lanka reaches out to IMF for help as FM Rajapaksa departs for New Delhi to sign fresh bailout package with India
snippet: Sri Lankan Government will seek financial support from the IMF, softening its resistance against the international lender as it desperately tries to salvage the country's beleaguered economy that is currently reeling under a severe foreign exchange crisis.

title: High Commissioner Moragoda meets India's Minister of Power and New and Renewable Energy to discuss further cooperation

title: US-funded cultural heritage preservation projects launched
snippet: US Ambassador Julie Chung this week visited Kandy to preside over events marking two milestones in the United States' long-standing support to preserving Sri Lanka's diverse cultural heritage, the US Embassy has said.

title: SLASSCOM and Daraz sign MoU to boost e-commerce data in Sri Lanka

title: Sri Lanka to be promoted all across Poland as a paradise destination
snippet: The Polish television TVN Discovery Group & National Geographic Traveler Magazine, one of the two predominant commercial TV broadcasters in Poland visited Sri Lanka on 03rd March 2022 to participate in a seven days FAM Tour around the country within the period of 03rd - 09th March 2022.
